revised_title: Electricity in Rocks and Metalliferous Veins: Experiments in Longclose and Rosewall Hill Mines
tldr: William Jory Henwood conducted experiments on the electric conditions of rocks and metalliferous veins in Longclose and Rosewall Hill Mines in Cornwall. He used copper and zinc plates and copper wires to study the electrical properties of the rocks and mineral deposits. His work contributed to the understanding of the geological and electrochemical processes in mining areas.
